result.execSummary:
The defendant William P Moran III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
- Seek/Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

- No possession of any firearms or weapons.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
- Defendant is to not involve himself with rapping over the course of his probation.

- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Defendant to be monitored by randon urine testing.

timeConds.notes: - Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction with goodtime credit; straight time.
- Defendant is to complete 100 hours of Community Service at a non profit or charitable organization.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William P Moran III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant's Motion for release privileges is DENIED; the court intended the defendant to serve the sentence without release privileges.
  Order signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. jbs
Letter from defendant seeking Huber privileges or release on electronic monitoring.
Letter to defendant's mother.
Letter from defendant's mother about reduction of time.
Letters on behalf of the Defendant Received and Filed. LNR
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report Dated 07/01/2016 received and filed. LNR

Defendant William P Moran in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 78 MONTHS, with credit for 4 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 42 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.  

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 36 MONTHS.

- Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction with goodtime credit; straight time.
- Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION /AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Defendant to be monitored by randon urine testing. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons.
- Defendant is to not involve himself with rapping over the course of his probation.
- Seek/Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Defendant is to complete 100 hours of Community Service at a non profit or charitable organization. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Ineligible Voting; Notice & Acknowledgement; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant William P Moran in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and upon motion of the state, count 2 is dismissed and read in for sentencing. 


AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant GUILTY and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court orders Jury Trial vacated. 
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 7/5/2016 at 8:15, branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant William P Moran in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel is requesting another FPT prior to 5-11-2016 jury trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant William P Moran in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for final pretrial on 4-25-2016 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 5-11-2016 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-17-2016.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant William P Moran in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discovery issues remain outstanding and defense requests a date to review video with defendant.  Case set for 2-15-2016 at 1:15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant William P Moran in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Tyrone St. Junior for Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 1/19/16.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rocky Rococo's at 2094 Miller Park Way; Isabel R.; Shahana R. or Earl R

Defendant William P Moran in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant William P Moran in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
